results.title: HMG CoA reductase inhibition modulates VEGF-induced endothelial cell hyperpermeability by preventing RhoA activation and myosin regulatory light chain phosphorylation.
results.text_hl: Remarkably, cotreatment of endothelial cells with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a hydrophobic statin, reversed @GENE_VEGFA @GENE_7422 @@@VEGF@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Mucolipidoses</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009081 @@@GEnC@@@ hyperpermeability by preventing MLC diphosphorylation, and cytoskeletal remodeling.

citations.NLM: Zeng L, Xu H, Chew TL, Eng E, Sadeghi MM, Adler S, Kanwar YS, Danesh FR. HMG CoA reductase inhibition modulates VEGF-induced endothelial cell hyperpermeability by preventing RhoA activation and myosin regulatory light chain phosphorylation. FASEB J. 2005 Nov;19(13):1845-7. PMID: 16160062
